headline: Microsoft to keep buying enough renewable energy to match all its electricity needs
summary: Microsoft has promised to keep buying enough renewable energy to match all its electricity needs after meeting that ‌goal for the first time last year, as tech giants ramp up ‌capital expenditure on an AI-fuelled expansion of power-hungry data centres.  The company said on Wednesday that it had reached ​its 2025 goal by contracting 40 gigawatts of new renewable energy supply, mainly through power purchase agreements - long-term contracts that help utility providers to bring new projects forward.  Nineteen gigawatts of that renewable energy has already been supplied to the power grid, Microsoft said, with ‌the rest to follow over ⁠the next five years and covering 26 countries in total.

content.title: Microsoft to keep buying enough renewable energy to match all its electricity needs
content.summary: Microsoft has promised to keep buying enough renewable energy to match all its electricity needs after meeting that ‌goal for the first time last year, as tech giants ramp up ‌capital expenditure on an AI-fuelled expansion of power-hungry data centres. Nineteen gigawatts of that renewable energy has already been supplied to the power grid, Microsoft said, with ‌the rest to follow over ⁠the next five years and covering 26 countries in total.

headline: How Apple's Contrarian 'Nah, We're Good' Strategy Defies Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is the odd one out in Big Tech’s AI spending race. While the rest of the Magnificent 7 are collectively committing around $700 billion in capital expenditure (capex) over the next year, Apple cut its own spending 19% year-over-year last quarter to $2.37 billion. The chart, published by A16Z, captures the gap visually. Since 2014, Apple’s quarterly capex line has barely moved. Every other Big Tech line has turned parabolic. headline: Amazon and Nvidia Lead Mag 7 Rally
summary: Magnificent Seven stocks gave Wednesday’s broad market rally a big tech boost. Amazon.com was up 2.4%, while Nvidia was up 2.1%. Tesla and Microsoft were both rallying 1.1%. Alphabet and Apple were up about 0.

headline: Reassessing Microsoft (MSFT) Valuation After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: Why Microsoft (MSFT) is back in focus for investors Recent share price pressure has pushed Microsoft (MSFT) further off its highs, putting the stock back on many investors’ watchlists as they reassess how its current valuation lines up with underlying fundamentals. See our latest analysis for Microsoft. Microsoft’s recent pullback, including a 13.7% 1 month share price decline and a 16.1% year to date share price decline to US$396.86, contrasts with its 60.4% 3 year total shareholder return...

headline: Why Is CoStar (CSGP) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Shares of real estate data provider CoStar Group (NASDAQ:CSGP) jumped 6.7% in the afternoon session after the company unveiled a new artificial intelligence tool, Homes AI, for its Homes.com real estate platform.

content.title: Why Is CoStar (CSGP) Stock Soaring Today
content.summary: Shares of real estate data provider CoStar Group (NASDAQ:CSGP) jumped 6.7% in the afternoon session after the company unveiled a new artificial intelligence tool, Homes AI, for its Homes.com real estate platform.

headline: Atlassian names LinkedIn veteran James Chuong as CFO
summary: Atlassian on Wednesday named James Chuong as its new ‌chief financial officer, effective March ‌30, taking over from Joe Binz.  Chuong, 46, will ​join the enterprise software company after over a decade as the finance chief of LinkedIn, a subsidiary of Microsoft.  In ‌his new ⁠role, he will oversee Atlassian's finance and legal teams, the ⁠company said.

content.title: Atlassian names LinkedIn veteran James Chuong as CFO
content.summary: Atlassian on Wednesday named James Chuong as its new ‌chief financial officer, effective March ‌30, taking over from Joe Binz.  Chuong, 46, will ​join the enterprise software company after over a decade as the finance chief of LinkedIn, a subsidiary of Microsoft.  In ‌his new ⁠role, he will oversee Atlassian's finance and legal teams, the ⁠company said.

headline: Cathie Wood buys $14 million of megacap AI stocks
summary: Cathie Wood didn’t hesitate when tech investors started flinching. On Feb. 17, ARK’s daily disclosures showed buys of $8 million in Broadcom (AVGO) and about $6 million in Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). That’s a massive $14 million combined push into two of the biggest AI infrastructure giants, just ...
